description:
Description
'Instructional dataset, N=807, cross-sectional individual data on smoking 
accompanying Introductory Econometrics: A Modern Approach, 
Jeffrey M. Wooldridge, South-Western College Publishing, (c) 2000 and Jeffrey 
M. Wooldridge, Econometric Analysis of Cross Section and Panel Data, MIT Press,
(c) 2001.'
(https://ideas.repec.org/p/boc/bocins/smoke.html#biblio, accessed 
February 27, 2017).
This dataset is a subset of data used in Mullahy (1997).
Data was collected in 1979 and 1980 through the Smoking Supplement to the
US National Health Interview Survey.
title: Survey Responses on Smoking Behaviour
reference:
Wooldridge(2009)'s dataset also available in other formats at
https://ideas.repec.org/p/boc/bocins/smoke.html#biblio.

parameters.cigpric: State cigarette price, cents per pack.
parameters.cigs: Number of cigarettes smoked per day.
parameters.restaurn:
Dummy variable indicating if state restaurant smoking 
restrictions are in place.
parameters.cigs_intervals:
Number of cigarettes smoked per day, coded in 
intervals with intervals boundaries: (0,5,10,20,50)
parameters.smoker:
Dummy variable indicating if person has smoked at least
one cigarette.

format: This data frame contains the following columns:
